cont.entity_a: Versatile 32mm focal length for both photo and video work.
Vivid color and sharpness at f/2.8. Great for landscapes and tight spaces in low light. Fast lens with stunning picture quality in low light.
cont.entity_b: Phenomenal results in low light with new Sony video camera.

cont.entity_a: Barely perceptible barrel distortion on a crop sensor camera. Slight distortion easily corrected in post. Heavy vignetting and softness in corners, but works well if understood.
At a low cost and weight. Very sharp images. Crisp and sharp images, good for beginners. Great image quality for ultra-wide angle use.
cont.entity_b: Great optics with unparalleled results and 2X converter. Tack sharp images and great bokeh, especially for portraits. Tack sharp images with the ability to eye auto focus.

cont.entity_a: Manual mode is preferred. Fast and accurate focus compared to 50mm L f/1.2 lens. Slow focus for night use.
cont.entity_b: SSM feature is quiet and fast.

cont.entity_a: With metal and glass, preferred over cheaper lenses. Well-built.
cont.entity_b: Build quality and image quality justify the price tag.

cont.entity_a: Wide angle with a 2.0 aperture when using Aputure DEC Lensregain.
Fast and accurate focus compared to 50mm L f/1.2 lens. Slow focus for night use.

cont.entity_b: Worth the price for high-end cameras, especially full-frame.

cont.entity_a: Fixed focal length but versatile and sharp.
Slight flaring, recommend using a lens hood.
Colors can appear lifeless and lacking detail.

cont.entity_b: Intermittent overexposure issue resolved with replacement. Fast replacement service from Amazon.
